New Records: Mexico won 3-0 against New Zealand, scoring three goals in the match
Key Match Events: Orbelin Pineda volleyed home Mexico's first goal from their last three games in less than five minutes
Cesar Huerta scored a right-footed shot to double the lead early in the second half
Luis Romo's shot from outside the box found the bottom right corner for Mexico's third goal
Pre-Game Insights: Javier Aguirre’s third stint in charge of the Mexico Men’s National Team began with a statement 3-0 win over New Zealand
Post-Match Reflections: It was one-way traffic inside a sparse Rose Bowl as Mexico, under new management, hit the ground running against a struggling New Zealand side
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand had to wait until the 70th minute to register their first effort on target via Matthew Garbett
Santiago Gimenez had another night to forget for the national side as his goal drought continued
Others: Guillermo Ochoa, Edson Álvarez, Raúl Jiménez or Hirving “Chucky” Lozano were not on the roster due to their absence
